history.text: Jim Carey was amazing in his role in Bruce Almighty
I agree! What did you think of his character?
He was very fitting for the character and quite hilarious!
I really liked his slapstick humor, and his portrayal of Bruce Nolan, the news reporter.
Morgan Freeman was also quite amazing too!
His humor is always off the charts!
Morgan Freeman is one of my favorite actors in the movie, and often seems to portray God in other movies.
he does and plays it very well in every one of them
Despite the Rotten Tomatoes score of 48%, I really enjoyed the movie overall, and think more people should see it.
I think it was great and more often then not I don't find the critics agreeing with me.
They seem to often view it purely from a cinematic standpoint, and not from an enjoyment standpoint.
This is very true they are also quite critical of little things that the general consenus finds of little importance.
What did you think of the relationship between Bruce and his girlfriend Grace Connelly, who was played by Jennifer Aniston?
I love jennifer aniston shes is a great actor all around, and pretty cute too!
How did you feel about Steve Carell's performance as Evan Baxter, Bruce's rival?
He played the part good, the jackass he is great for.
I really despised his character when he stole dialogue from Bruce and then stole his promotion.
I also liked how Bruce was given power to combat the bad luck he had all his life.
Yes that was pretty cool that he was given that power and the ability to battle back against his luck. Many never get that chance!
And the theft of his promotion was horrible!
I agree! Bruce does end up getting revenge though, when he uses his powers to make Evan humiliate himself, and Evan to be fired in favor of Bruce as the new anchor.
He does and that was one of my favorite parts!

What did you think of Bruce inventing an email system to deal with all the prayers he was receiving
?
Impressive wasnt it?
I thought it was quite funny when he automated the system, and had it answer yes to every prayer, which lead to a lot of funny moments.
One of the most touching scenes was when Bruce speaks to God for the final time, and he prays for Grace to find a man that will make her happy.
And then Bruce comes back to life and sees her there in the hospital.
Oh yeah I forgot about that, it was really touching and supportive of his wish!
All in all though it was a really good movie and pretty positive. Jim carrey def made it far more hilarious than another actor could have done
I thought the message of enjoying what you have was very powerful, and was supported by Bruce returning to field reporting, but enjoying it much more.
And I very much agree that Jim Carrey is the perfect actor for this movie
Very much so, and that thought isn't held very dear with society anymore.

uid2response.feedback: I saw it many years ago, the second document didn't pop up till the end.
